intro: Spergularia molluginea, commonly known as the sand spurry, is a small flowering plant belonging to the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae). It is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils, often in coastal or arid environments. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to retain moisture in dry conditions. Spergularia molluginea is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soils and thrive in harsh environments.
